QuestionText: Which of the following is NOT one of Porterâ€™s Five Forces?
What is the primary objective of a cost leadership strategy?
OptionA: Charge the highest prices in premium segments
OptionB: Achieve the lowest industry-wide cost position while meeting acceptable quality standards
OptionC: Focus on a narrow niche with unique features regardless of cost
OptionD: Maximize customer switching costs through brand community
CorrectAnswer: Achieve the lowest industry-wide cost position while meeting acceptable quality standards

QuestionText: In the BCG Growth-Share Matrix, a business unit with high market share in a low-growth industry is classified as a:
According to the VRIO framework, a resource that is valuable, rare, costly to imitate, and the firm is organized to exploit will most likely lead to:
In the Ansoff Matrix, introducing a new product into a new market is an example of:
Which of the following is an example of backward vertical integration?
OptionA: A fashion brand launching its own retail boutiques
OptionB: A car manufacturer acquiring a steel producer
OptionC: A consumer electronics firm signing an exclusive reseller agreement
OptionD: A beverage company purchasing a national vending machine network
CorrectAnswer: A car manufacturer acquiring a steel producer

QuestionText: Blue Ocean Strategy is best described as:
OptionA: Competing head-to-head by undercutting prices in an existing market
OptionB: Increasing advertising spend to capture market share in mature markets
OptionC: Outsourcing non-core activities to reduce costs
OptionD: Creating uncontested market space by simultaneously pursuing differentiation and low cost
CorrectAnswer: Creating uncontested market space by simultaneously pursuing differentiation and low cost

QuestionText: Which is a primary risk of pursuing a differentiation strategy?
OptionA: Buyers may not perceive enough added value to justify the premium price
OptionB: Economies of scale may increase too quickly
OptionC: Suppliers will gain excessive bargaining power
OptionD: Industry growth will accelerate and erode margins
CorrectAnswer: Buyers may not perceive enough added value to justify the premium price

QuestionText: Which of the following is NOT typically included in a PESTEL analysis?
Network effects most directly create which strategic condition for a platform business?
OptionA: Lower fixed costs relative to rivals
OptionB: Demand-side economies of scale that strengthen barriers to entry as the user base grows
OptionC: Higher bargaining power of suppliers due to increased volume
OptionD: Guaranteed first-mover advantage regardless of execution
CorrectAnswer: Demand-side economies of scale that strengthen barriers to entry as the user base grows
